normalised: Hey folks, ever felt like Mumbai's air has been a bit... off lately? You're not alone! Air quality across several Indian cities, including Delhi and even Bangalore, has been fluctuating like a Bollywood drama. The Central Pollution Control Board (C P C B) is keeping a close watch, with experts suggesting that vehicle emissions and construction dust are major culprits. Remember those Diwali fireworks? They also played a role in the recent spike, yikes! According to experts at I I T-Kanpur, we need more green spaces and stricter enforcement of pollution control measures. Maybe channel some "Lagaan" spirit and work together, right? The good news is, some initiatives are showing promise. Planting more trees and promoting electric vehicles are definitely steps in the right direction. Let's hope we can breathe a little easier soon! Keep an eye on the daily A Q I reports, folks, and maybe dust off those air purifiers! Stay safe and stay informed!
